summary.what_happened: At 09:05Z, a CPU utilization alert fired on the staging-web-pool indicating >75% usage for 5 minutes. A single pod (web-frontend-7b4d2) is consuming elevated CPU due to a scheduled load test that runs every Monday 09:00-09:30 UTC against staging.
summary.current_status: MONITORING – CPU spike appears to be expected behavior from scheduled load test. No customer impact.

suspected_root_causes.hypothesis: Scheduled Monday load test (09:00-09:30 UTC) driving expected CPU increase on staging-web-pool
evidence: CPU spike started at 09:05Z, consistent with 09:00 scheduled load test start
Alert is on staging environment only, no production impact
75% threshold is normal for staging under load test conditions

suspected_root_causes.hypothesis: Memory leak or inefficient code path in web-frontend causing CPU spinning
evidence: [UNKNOWN] No memory metrics provided to correlate
Only one data point (5 min window) – insufficient to establish pattern

immediate_actions.step: Verify the Monday load test is currently running: check load-test scheduler logs in staging CI/CD pipeline
Monitor CPU for next 25 minutes – if the spike resolves by 09:30Z this confirms the load test hypothesis
If CPU remains elevated past 09:35Z, investigate pod web-frontend-7b4d2 for code-level issues: kubectl top pod web-frontend-7b4d2 -n staging
